intro: Eriogonum grayi, commonly known as Gray's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and grasslands. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eriogonum grayi is often found in areas with limited soil moisture, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments.
